channel.title: How to make a 508 Webclient!
channel.description:
Ok this is my first tutorial on 503 Sections. Client Setup 1. Download any 508 HD Client (Must not be an IP changer) Perhaps this? [508 HD Client] None IP-Changer 2. Open Client.java, press & hold CTRL + F. 3. In the search box put 127.0.0.1, now hit 'Find' 4. Replace '127.0.0.1' with your server's IP adress. 5. Save the file, now compile the client. Jar Setup 1. Download Jar Maker. You can simple Google it. 2. Now, For the Input File select your client folder. 3. For the Output File, use your Desktop or wherever you want the Jar to appear. Name the Jar 'Loader.jar' 4. Click on 'Set Manifest' and set it as 'client' 5. Jar the file and you are finished with this procedure. Host Setup 1. Create a new folder called Webclient 2. Create a new file called 'Loader.html' in your Webclient folder. Code: [code]HD Webclient
[/code]

*Server name* HD Webclient

Visit our website at www.*website url*

If the client does not load download the cache

Server Created by: *Your name*

[code]
[/code] 3. Now get a backround image that is .PNG, drag it into your Webclient folder then rename it BACK 4. Drag your 'Loader.jar' into your Webclient folder. 5. Portfoward port 88, 80, and 8080. 6. Your Webclient URL is your server's IP adress. Cache Download Now, you will need the 508 HD Cache. You can download the Cache perfectly with Brawler's Cache Installer. You can download it here. Credits : 40 % me 60 & someguy on ******scape Hope it Works ;D

item.title: How to make a 508 Webclient!
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Zachs Owner Zachs
item.description:
@Owner_Zachs wrote:

[quote=“bergsnes, post:1, topic:376080”]Ok this is my first tutorial on 503 Sections.
Client Setup

  1. Download any 508 HD Client (Must not be an IP changer) Perhaps this? [508 HD Client] None IP-Changer
  2. Open Client.java, press & hold CTRL + F.
  3. In the search box put 127.0.0.1, now hit ‘Find’
  4. Replace ‘127.0.0.1’ with your server’s IP adress.
  5. Save the file, now compile the client.

Jar Setup

  1. Download Jar Maker. You can simple Google it.
  2. Now, For the Input File select your client folder.
  3. For the Output File, use your Desktop or wherever you want the Jar to appear. Name the Jar ‘Loader.jar’
  4. Click on ‘Set Manifest’ and set it as ‘client’
  5. Jar the file and you are finished with this procedure.

Host Setup

  1. Create a new folder called Webclient
  2. Create a new file called ‘Loader.html’ in your Webclient folder.
    Code:

[code]HD Webclient

[/code]

*Server name* HD Webclient

Visit our website at www.*website url*

If the client does not load download the cache

Server Created by: *Your name*

[code]

[/code] 3. Now get a backround image that is .PNG, drag it into your Webclient folder then rename it BACK 4. Drag your 'Loader.jar' into your Webclient folder. 5. Portfoward port 88, 80, and 8080. 6. Your Webclient URL is your server's IP adress.

Cache Download

Now, you will need the 508 HD Cache.
You can download the Cache perfectly with Brawler’s Cache Installer.
You can download it here.

Credits :
40 % me
60 & someguy on ******scape

Hope it Works ;D[/quote]

I don’t have a client.java so I tried GUI and that didnt work! Idk what the mainclass is!

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a 508 Webclient!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:4, topic:376080”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=472015.msg3452205#msg3452205 date=1293828241]
Pretty much a copy of Ric’s tutorial, because you’re not doing anything special.

You also obviously have no knowledge of what you are doing:

Also, the port forwarding is only needed if you are hosting the web server on your computer; other wise you are just opening yourself up.

Lastly, this will only work with HD clients, because they load the cache from your c drive. The other types of 508 clients do not.
[/quote]
(
all true cept hd part cause u can change ur clients signlink to load from c:[/quote]Yea, but the tutorial doesn’t show how to do that.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a 508 Webclient!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Pretty much a copy of Ric’s tutorial, because you’re not doing anything special.

You also obviously have no knowledge of what you are doing:

Also, the port forwarding is only needed if you are hosting the web server on your computer; other wise you are just opening yourself up.

Lastly, this will only work with HD clients, because they load the cache from your c drive. The other types of 508 clients do not.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a 508 Webclient!
item.dc:creator: @bergsnes bergsnes
item.description:
@bergsnes wrote:

Ok this is my first tutorial on 503 Sections.
Client Setup

    Code:

[code]HD Webclient
